page.title: 14NEW ABBEY - LOCAL HISTORY(1)
page.content: Evidence of early occupation by man is shown by a Neolithic burial barrow on Lochhill,an Iron Age motte at Ingleston, bronze finds at Kirkconnell and a crannog on Loch Kindar. The village grew around Sweetheart Abbey,at first outside the walled precincts,but later also inside. After its dissolution about 1610, the abbey stone became housebuilding material, but there are fine remains of the buildings,constructed of pinkish-red sandstone. New Abbey has had many mills - corn, timber,snuff and flax - and two ponds, once stocked with monastic fish. A century ago families were large and many people were poor. Most people worked on the land.It was quite common for old people to have hardly ever left the village. Now all that has changed with the coming of the car.
